title: Font of German TV Channel
content:
Hi!

I’m lookin for the font that “VIVA Zwei” used to use.

You’ll find the video over here and some stills in attachment:  
 [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dg3ZVsQHGgU](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051233/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=dg3ZVsQHGgU "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dg3ZVsQHGgU")

Many thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [VIVAZwei\_04.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051233/http:/typophile.com/files/VIVAZwei_04.jpg) | 167.54 KB |
| [VIVAZwei\_05.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051233/http:/typophile.com/files/VIVAZwei_05.jpg) | 166.71 KB |
| [VIVAZwei\_06.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051233/http:/typophile.com/files/VIVAZwei_06.jpg) | 170.84 KB |

 [‹ Slab Serif Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051233/http:/typophile.com/node/50573 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can anyone help me identify this one ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051233/http:/typophile.com/node/50477 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alocirfa

comments.content: Yeah, that’s about to fit! Thank you : - )

Hmm, now I see...  
I’m not sure. It’s definitely Interstate, but it could also be “monospaced regular” or just “regular”, couldn’t it?

Other opinions?

EDIT:  
What do you think which Interstate Compressed style it is?

There are “light” and “regular”.  
(I never was very into that lettering thing so I couldn’t even imagine how many different typefaces there are with such little differences between ’em and it’s hard for my untrained eyes to see them)  
 [http://www.fontshop.de/sukr.php3?ch=%2Fsearch.php3%3Fns%3D1%26sns%3D0%26...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051233/http:/www.fontshop.de/sukr.php3?ch=%2Fsearch.php3%3Fns%3D1%26sns%3D0%26searchtype%3Dfo-kw%26searchtext%3DInterstate%26area%3Dbooks%26action.x%3D0%26action.y%3D0%26action%3DSuchen "http://www.fontshop.de/sukr.php3?ch=%2Fsearch.php3%3Fns%3D1%26sns%3D0%26searchtype%3Dfo-kw%26searchtext%3DInterstate%26area%3Dbooks%26action.x%3D0%26action.y%3D0%26action%3DSuchen")

Many thanks for your help!!
